#Text=Ukrainian Paralympic Committee announces decision to compete at Games so their goal of peace will not be forgotten
#Text=Friday , March 7 , 2014
#Text=After the announcement the press conference venue was changed , the media surged towards the new location Image :
#Text=Illya K.
#Text=President of the Ukrainian Paralympic Committee Valeriy Sushkevich
#Text=Image : Illya K.
#Text=After the announcement the press conference venue was changed , the media surged towards the new location Image : Illya K.
#Text=Sochi , Russia —

#Text=At a press conference this afternoon in Sochi , the President of the Ukrainian Paralympic Committee , Valeriy Sushkevich , announced the Ukrainian Paralympic team would compete at this year 's Paralympics in Russia as a unified sovereign state .
#Text=He said the Ukrainian Paralympic team is very democratic , and reached this decision together .
#Text=Their view is if they boycotted the Games , their message of peace would be forgotten in a few hours .

#Text=While stating the team intends to compete , the Ukrainian team reserved the right to leave the Games immediately should peace not happen , and the Russian military does further intervention in the Ukraine .

#Text=Sushkevich , who is also a member of the Ukrainian Parliament , denied accusations their comments and decisions have been political in regards to the two hour delay for the team 's welcome to the Paralympic village , and actions taken during the welcome ceremony .
#Text=Rather , he claimed these actions were motivated by a message of peace and human rights .
#Text=He claimed the situation for Ukraine is unique .
#Text=According to Sushkevich , never before during the Paralympic Games has the host country invaded a participating country .
#Text=Suskevich talked about a discussion he had yesterday with Vladimir Putin , the leader of Russia , where Sushkevich talked to Putin as a member of the Paralympic family .
#Text=He said he asked Putin for peace , for detente at least until the Paralympic Games are over .
#Text=The response he received from Putin was that he was heard and Putin would think about what he said .
#Text=The President said that he views the achievements of the Paralympics above that of the Olympics , that the Paralympics play a vital role in the lives of the athletes .
#Text=He said the 31 members of the Ukrainian team want to compete .
#Text=There is a problem being the national team of the Ukraine , though , when the country is not whole .
#Text=He later said the team has representatives from ten regions of the country , including the western Russian parts .
#Text=Further comments were made by Ukrainian Paralympic Committee President that in past few years , all of Ukraine 's Paralympians who were veterans of the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan .
#Text=He hoped in the future , there would be peace and there would be no need to have veterans on the team who had disabilities that were a result of war .
#Text=Ukrainian biathlon competitor Grygorii Vovchynskyii also spoke during the press conference .
#Text=He said Ukrainian Paralympians are part of a big family , and supporters ask them every day how they feel .
#Text=According to Vovchynskyii , Ukrainian Paralympians want peace .
#Text=They are ready to compete .
#Text=They want to show they are a free and independent people who love fair competition .
#Text=At a press conference immediately following the Ukrainian one , IPC representative Craig Spence said IPC learned of Ukraine 's decision to compete at the same time as the media .
#Text=He said he would prefer Ukraine competes but would understand if they decided to leave .
#Text=Spence also said all 45 teams and all competing athletes were reminded there could be no alterations to their kits , and no protests .
#Text=Everyone is bound by these rules , and the IPC is monitoring social media for athlete compliance .
